Articles.Content: I would like for the tutorial cartoon videos to be published independently of the actual game so we can watch them when not playing KSP2, or just for the fun of watching them. The KSP Youtube channel would do nicely as a platform for publishing
They will probably appear anyway. You know, people record things from games and upload them.

I wouldn't be surprised if they were all in a folder somewhere in the ksp2 install itself, and you could just copy them wherever you wanted.

Only potential hurdle would be if they're not in a easily used format, but I'm sure the community would roll a tool to convert them to MP4 in time.
I could see this happening. Maybe we'll even get a few early game tutorials uploaded pre-release as promotional material.
Yes, I agree, having the tutorials, and whatever KSPedia equivalent there may be, available for out of game viewing/download would be very handy.

On 4/3/2022 at 10:39 PM, Incarnation of Chaos said:

I wouldn't be surprised if they were all in a folder somewhere in the ksp2 install itself, and you could just copy them wherever you wanted.

Only potential hurdle would be if they're not in a easily used format, but I'm sure the community would roll a tool to convert them to MP4 in time.

Or just record them from in-game.

On 4/8/2022 at 11:05 PM, Bej Kerman said:

Or just record them from in-game.

There's no guarantee that all will be uploaded in acceptable quality that way

Edited April 19, 2022 by Maria Sirona
